intro: Nidularium serratum, commonly known as the serrated nest fern, is a unique plant belonging to the Polypodiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, fan-shaped fronds that resemble a nest, giving it its common name. The plant has a creeping rhizome that produces erect, spore-bearing spikes, which are typically found at the base of the fronds. Its leaves are serrated and have a leathery texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Nidularium serratum is native to tropical regions of South America and is often grown as a decorative houseplant due to its unique appearance.
